vehicles.description: A white sedan is located to the front left side of this vehicle and is traveling in the same direction.
vehicles.explanation: The behavior of this vehicle will determine the safe following distance and may affect the lane choice and speed of our vehicle.

traffic cones.description: A series of black traffic cones are placed diagonally to the left in front of the vehicle, marking the boundary for a work area or lane closure.
traffic cones.explanation: These conical objects indicate that the vehicle should stay in the current lane and may adjust its speed due to the narrowing of the drivable space on the road.

general_perception.description and explanation: In the provided traffic image, there is a white sedan located to the front left side of the ego vehicle, traveling in the same direction. The behavior of this vehicle will determine the safe following distance and may affect the lane choice and speed of the ego vehicle. Additionally, a series of black traffic cones are placed diagonally to the left in front of the vehicle, marking the boundary for a work area or lane closure. These cones indicate that the vehicle should stay in the current lane and may need to adjust its speed due to the narrowing of the drivable space on the road.

driving_suggestion: Our vehicle should maintain a safe distance behind the white sedan, paying attention to its brake lights and turn signals to observe any changes in speed or direction and be ready to make the corresponding adjustments. It should continue in the current lane, following behind the traffic cones, and only change lanes when it is safe to do so and when indicated. Proceed with caution while following the restricted path defined by the traffic cones. Maintain a safe speed that allows for an immediate response to the sudden movements of stopped vehicles or potential hazards that may appear in the restricted area. Be prepared to stop or maneuver the vehicle if necessary.

1.description and explanation: This object is a traffic cone, commonly used on roads or footpaths to temporarily redirect traffic in a safe manner. It is placed on the road surface to indicate areas that are off-limits to vehicles or to denote where construction or accident areas begin. The ego car should steer clear of the area marked by the cone to avoid hazards or entering a restricted zone.

2.description and explanation: This object is a traffic cone typically used to mark areas where vehicles should not pass. Its bright color and noticeable size are designed to capture the attention of drivers, informing them to maneuver around the object. For future driving behavior, the ego car must avoid this cone to maintain a clear and safe path and potentially adjust its travel lane if the cone indicates a closed or hazardous lane ahead.
